name: Banana Oatmeal Almond Smoothie
description: My bananas were ripening so quickly last summer that every week I froze one or two, knowing I would use them for smoothies at some point. When you freeze bananas, peel them first, then double wrap in plastic. I bulked up this smoothie with oatmeal, which I first soaked until it was softened in just enough water to cover.
keywords: dairy-free, gluten-free, halal, high fiber, kosher, low cholesterol, vegan, vegetarian, fall, spring, summer, winter
recipeIngredient: 2 to 3 tablespoons hot or boiling water (enough to just cover the oats)
1 cup unsweetened almond milk, or 1/3 cup light coconut milk and 2/3 cup almond milk
1 tablespoon soaked chia seeds (1 teaspoon dry unsoaked; see note)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the rolled oats and hot or boiling water in a small bowl or ramekin and leave until the oatmeal is soft, about 15 minutes.
Place all of the ingredients (including the soaked oatmeal) in a blender and blend at high speed for 1 minute. Serve at once.
